preqs: Students must have passed ETX2111, ETX2121, ETF2121, ETF2100 or ETC1010 before undertaking this unit or must be enrolled in course 3822 or 4412.

rules.ruleString: Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ETC1010, ETF2100, ETF2121, ETX2111, ETX2121} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS}
For COURSE_CODE NOT IN {3822, 4412} Do Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ETC1010, ETF2100, ETF2121, ETX2111, ETX2121} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS} Otherwise true

description: Forecasts are crucial for guiding the planning and decision making process in business. In this unit you will learn to apply reliable methods for generating accurate forecasts in a rapidly changing business environment. These include: an introduction to regression modelling from a forecasting perspective, classical decomposition, exponential smoothing, Box-Jenkins ARIMA modelling and judgemental forecasting. You will build your programming skills by learning to program in R, a free programming language for statistical computing.
